intro: Jacquemontia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow woodbine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and opposite, with a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, round seeds.
